New Records: Rhys Hoskins' grand slam was his third, tying a franchise record, and the Brewers' 10th grand slam of the season, also a franchise record
Key Match Events: Rhys Hoskins hit a grand slam off Sean Manaea in the first inning, giving the Brewers an early 4-0 lead
Brice Turang went 3 for 4 with three runs and three of Milwaukee's six steals
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets, Arizona Diamondbacks, and Atlanta Braves are chasing the final two National League wild cards
The Mets and Braves have identical 87-71 records after Atlanta beat the Kansas City Royals 3-0 on Friday
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said the team 'kept fighting' despite the loss
Rhys Hoskins said the Brewers' win was 'huge' for them as they prepare for the playoffs
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers improved to 11-1 in their last 12 games against the Mets
New York's loss spoiled the return of star shortstop Francisco Lindor, who went 2 for 4 with a walk and committed an error in his first appearance since Sept. 15
Others: Brewers RF Sal Frelick left after crashing into the sidewall while trying to make a leaping catch of a foul ball in the third inning
Alvarez exited with back spasms after sliding into third in the seventh
